meanings.definition: The act of moving around something in a circular path.
meanings.sent1: During the race, the cars made a circumambulation around the track.
meanings.sent2: The hikers enjoyed a peaceful circumambulation around the lake.
meanings.sent3: The children found joy in their playful circumambulation around the playground.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to be in a constant circumambulation around the same topic.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the waves matched the gentle circumambulation of the lighthouse beam.

meanings.definition: The act of walking around a sacred object or place as a form of worship or reverence.
meanings.sent1: The pilgrims completed their circumambulation around the temple with solemnity.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony involved a traditional circumambulation of the shrine.
meanings.sent3: The tourists observed the ritualistic circumambulation with curiosity.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his faith was evident in his daily circumambulation around the sacred tree.
meanings.sent5: The monks' synchronized circumambulation around the stupa was a mesmerizing sight.
